head.supplied: 23/9/93. ¶ ¶ Yesterday, dear Mr Deane, arrived the superb set of proof-plates for the new part of the lamented Mr Fitzgerald's work. ¶ I am just on the eve of departure for the Adelaide Meeting of t...

div.p: No. 547, folder 28, series 4, MS 610 Deane family papers, National Library of Australia, Canberra.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Yesterday, dear Mr Deane, arrived the superb set of proof-plates for the new part of the lamented Mr Fitzgerald's work.
R. Fitzgerald (1875-94), vol. 2, part 5. I am just on the eve of departure for the Adelaide Meeting of the Australian Association,
In the event, ill-health prevented M from attending the Adelaide meeting of the Australasian Association for the Advancement of Science; see M to A. Macdonald, 25 September 1893. and must defer thus for some few days my attending to the very careful inspection of these pictures; but from a hurried glance on them, it does not appear that any much has to be altered. My aid will mainly consist, so far as I can see, in furnishing additional notes for the text. Would you be so kind, to let me know by about a week's time, to what extent the text is ready in each instance, and therefore what particular notes would be required to be added. I would know then exactly what to do, and no unnecessary redactation would take place. We would then also have some plan, on which I could aid you in future. New localities may probably also be obtained from me, if I know which
are those, recorded by you. For instance, the Epipogum was found by the Right Rev. Dr J. F. Turner, Lord Bishop of Armidale on the Richmond River, and by Mr Wilcox on the Clarence-River.
Both rivers in NSW. Mr Fitzgerald may or may not have been aware of these localities. So I am expecting still further detail suggestions from you by the beginning of October.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
